meanings.definition: To have a feeling of aversion or dislike towards something.
meanings.sent2: She tends to dishlike scary movies.
meanings.sent3: Even though it's just a movie, she can't help but dishlike the villain.
meanings.sent4: His face would dishlike whenever he saw a spider.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fish made her dishlike it instantly.

meanings.definition: Resembling a dish in appearance or shape.
meanings.sent1: The round, flat hat had a dishlike shape.
meanings.sent2: The UFO had a dishlike appearance in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The dishlike design of the new building caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled in a dishlike manner for the costume party.
meanings.sent5: The artist created a dishlike sculpture out of clay.
